Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game
public class Game extends Object
The Game Class serves as the main controller for the Animal Tracking Game. It manages player creation, trail selection, turn execution for each player one by one. One player is Human, Another is Computer. Players move along a trail, encounter features that may or may not have a penalty, spot animals randomly for points, and game continues until one player reaches the finish line or human quits. Winner is only declared when a player reaches finish line.

    • adjustPlayerScore

      private void adjustPlayerScore(Player player, int points)
      Adjust a player's score by specific points.
      Parameters:
      player - The players whose score is to be adjusted
      points - The number of points to add/subtract

    • checkAnimalSighting

      private void checkAnimalSighting(Player player, StringBuilder message)
      Check if the player sights an animal at their current position, and adjusts the score accordingly.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom check is to be performed
      message - StringBuilder to append all messages on player's current turn

    • clearScreen

      private void clearScreen()
      Clears the console screen

    • declareWinner

      private void declareWinner(StringBuilder exitMessageBuilder)
      Determines and announces the winner based on scores.
      Parameters:
      exitMessageBuilder - StringBuilder to append winner message. Messages are printed along with the game board with the help of shared string builder.

    • displayGameBoard

      private void displayGameBoard(String message)
      Displays the complete game board with score board, trails, and messages of last executed turn.
      Parameters:
      message - Message to display below the board.

      Displays the current score of both players.

      Returns:
      The game's trail.

      public Player getPlayer1()
      Gets player 1.

      The player 1 from the game (human)

    • getPlayer2

      public Player getPlayer2()
      Gets player 2.
      Returns:
      The player 2 from the game (computer)

    • handleNatureFeature

      private void handleNatureFeature(Player player, StringBuilder message)
      Handles the effect of landing on nature feature. Checks if the player landed on a feature and moves them, according to the penalty.
      Parameters:
      player - player Player who just landed on a position on trail
      message - StringBuilder to append messages about this feature's impact. Message is displayed with the GameBoad with other events that may have occured during the turn.

    • handlePlayerReachedEnd

      private void handlePlayerReachedEnd(Player player)
      Displays a messages when a player reaches the end and waits for user acknowledgement before displaying the final result. This is to make sure user can read the last dice roll turn events.

    • movePlayer

      private void movePlayer(Player player, int spaces)
      Moves a player by a specific number of spaces.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to move
      spaces - Number of spaces to move (can be negative)

    • playTurn

      private void playTurn(Player player)
      Executes a player's turn including dice roll, movement, and events. Rolls the dice, moves the player, checks if they sighted an animal, handle space penalty if any based on nature feature they may have landed on, and finally displays the GameBoard with latest score, trail and messages from all the above occured events. for eg. space penalty, dice roll result, animal sighting points, etc.
      Parameters:
      player - Player whose turn is being executed

    • requestComplexTrail

      private void requestComplexTrail()
      Sets up a complex trail for the Game. The complex trail is 15 to 30 positions in length, with up to three nature features of each type placed randomly on the trail.

    • requestEasyTrail

      private void requestEasyTrail()
      Sets up an easy trail for the Game. The easy trail is 12 to 20 positions in length, with one nature feature of each type placed randomly on the trail.

    • requestPlayerName

      private void requestPlayerName()
      Prompts for and validate's the human player's name Name can be 1-10 chars without any trailing spaces

    • requestTrailType

      private void requestTrailType()
      Prompts and validates the user's trail difficulty choice between Easy(E) and Complex(C). Keeps prompting until they choose a valid trail.

    • runGame

      private void runGame()
      Main Game Loop that executes the entire game. Game continues until one player reaches the end of trail or human quits. Each player gets one turn a time.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Entry point through which a game is started.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-Line Arguments

    • setNatureTrail

      public void setNatureTrail(Trail trail)
      Sets the nature trail.
      Parameters:
      trail - The new trail to use if any

    • setPlayer1

      public void setPlayer1(Player player)
      Sets player one.
      Parameters:
      player - The new player one

    • setPlayer2

      public void setPlayer2(Player player)
      Sets player two.
      Parameters:
      player - The new player two

    • waitForEnter

      private void waitForEnter()
      Pauses the game until user press enter or quits.
